meanings.definition: Coenures: a group of individuals living together in a close-knit community
meanings.sent1: The coenures in the neighborhood always help each other.
meanings.sent2: The coenures gathered for a community picnic.
meanings.sent3: The coenures decided to organize a talent show for fun.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a coenures, tightly woven and supportive.
meanings.sent5: The coenures worked together like a well-oiled machine.

meanings.definition: Coenures: to form a close bond or relationship with others
meanings.sent1: She coenures with her classmates by helping them with their homework.
meanings.sent2: The team coenures well during challenging times.
meanings.sent3: He coenures easily with new colleagues due to his friendly nature.
meanings.sent4: Their shared love for music coenures them in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: The siblings coenures over their shared memories of childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: Coenures: the act of sharing resources and responsibilities within a group
meanings.sent1: The coenures of the team ensure everyone has what they need.
meanings.sent2: Coenures among friends make life easier for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The coenures of the household decided to rotate chores for fairness.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, the coenures of the community come together to support each other.
meanings.sent5: The coenures of the project allowed for a smooth and efficient workflow.
